@skulldragon

Don't give us this crap about needing to be rich to afford a computer capable of encoding. All computers made in the last 5 years can re-encode video with no problem, because they are all at least dual-core CPUs with 2 or 4 GB of RAM.

And why are you proud of not knowing how to do something? Just download this, and pick the xvid codec with the .avi format, at around 1000 kbit/s bitrate, then click convert.

http://download.cnet.com/Pazera-Free-MP4-to-AVI-Converter/3000-2194_4-10784027.html

about neeeding a new computer to do mp4...B.S.  I have an OLD laptop (1.8GHz single core CPU, 512MB RAM), and I rip & convert DVDs to mp4 all the time (and upload the torrents on TPB). There is a whole shit-load of free and easy one-click converters out there if using Avidemux, Megui, AutoGK (all also free) is too complicated. Another good freebie is Freemake Video Converter.
